properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 13 at 2:50PM EST until January 13 at 5:30PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
properties.description:
At 247 PM EST, the heavy rainfall that resulted in 1-2 inches of
accumulation across southeastern Mecklenburg and western Union
counties this morning ended abruptly as stronger thunderstorms
developed south and east of the area. Fortunately, these
thunderstorms intercepted the abundant moisture streaming into the
region and caused the ongoing moderate showers across the area to
end before more widespread nuisance flooding developed.
Nevertheless, several area streams are just now cresting from the
excessive runoff so the Flood Advisory will be continued to allow
area streams to crest and begin their recession.

Only light showers are expected through this afternoon and early
evening; therefore, any nuisance flooding from the heavy rainfall
that occurred this morning is expected to diminish by the time the
Flood Advisory expires later this afternoon.

Additional rounds of rainfall over saturated soils are expected
tonight through early tomorrow morning which may cause new flooding
to develop. People in the Charlotte metro area are advised to stay
weather aware.

Some locations that may continue to experience nuisance flooding
include...
Monroe, South Charlotte, Matthews, Mint Hill, Indian Trail,
Weddington, Stallings, Unionville, Pineville and Wesley Chapel.
properties.instruction:
Heavy rainfall has caused ponding of water in urban areas, highways,
streets and underpasses, as well as other poor-drainage areas and
low lying spots. Do not attempt to travel across flooded roads. Turn
around, dont drown.

A Flood Advisory means river or stream flows are elevated and
nuisance ponding of water in urban or other areas is likely.

NWSheadline: THE FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EST FOR SOUTHEASTERN MECKLENBURG AND CENTRAL UNION COUNTIES
